title: Polenta Crostini, Three Ways
yield: 1 recipe (about 5 cups) of hot cooked Polenta
introduction: Polenta Crostini offers a delightful alternative to traditional bread-based crostini. With its versatile and crisped base, it's perfect for a variety of delicious toppings, making it a fantastic choice for appetizers, side dishes, or even a base for hearty meals.

instructions.description: Prepare the polenta. As soon as the polenta is cooked, spread it with a rubber spatula to about 1/2-inch thickness on a large baking sheet. Cover and chill until firm, at least 1 hour and up to 3 days, before using.
When ready to cook, cut the polenta into squares or another shape with a knife, or cookie or biscuit cutter. The pieces can be baked, broiled, grilled, or fried.
Preheat the oven to 400°F. Oil a baking sheet and arrange the polenta slices on the sheet about 1/2 inch apart.
Brush the tops with oil. Bake 30 minutes or until crisp and lightly golden.
Place a barbecue grill or broiler rack about 4 inches away from the heat source. Preheat the grill or broiler.

Brush the polenta slices on both sides with olive oil. Place the pieces on the rack. Grill or broil, turning once, until crisp and golden, about 5 minutes. Turn the pieces and grill the other side about 5 minutes more.
Very lightly brush a thin film of corn or olive oil in a nonstick skillet. Heat the skillet over medium heat. Pat the polenta pieces dry.
Cook them until golden, about 5 minutes. Turn the pieces and cook until browned on the other side, about 5 minutes more.

toppings: Crumbled gorgonzola cheese and toasted pine nuts
A spoonful of chopped marinated sun-dried tomatoes and a slice of mozzarella. Heat in the oven until the cheese is softened.
A slice of fontina and thin-sliced mushrooms. Heat in the oven until the cheese is softened.
A slice of soppressata, prosciutto, or smoked salmon
A slice of mozzarella and an anchovy fillet
Soft fresh goat cheese, freshly ground black pepper, and watercress leaves
A spoonful of tomato sauce or ragù and shavings of Parmigiano-Reggiano
